input.description: The name of the actor adapter. Default: CASDActor

This wrapper creates a new change record in the Service Desk system.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <target> <soap-url>https://172.16.1.1:8443/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl</soap-url> <host>172.16.1.1</host> <user-name>ServiceDesk</user-name> <password>password</password> <port>8443</port> <protocol>https</protocol> <allow-unsigned-certificate>true</allow-unsigned-certificate> <install-certificate>true</install-certificate> <passphrase>changeit</passphrase> </target> <requestor>ServiceDesk,,</requestor> <affected-end-user>System_AM_User</affected-end-user> <assignee>ServiceDesk,,</assignee> <business-case>b2</business-case> <category>Add.Telco.Handset</category> <status>Open</status> <priority>3</priority> <created-by>ServiceDesk,,</created-by> <group>g1</group> <cab>Test Group</cab> <impact>1-entire organization</impact> <project>Test1</project> <closure-code>Successful</closure-code> <summary>Test summary</summary> <description>Test description</description> <schedule-start-date>11/03/2011 02:25 pm</schedule-start-date> <schedule-duration>10:30:00</schedule-duration> <cab-approval>true</cab-approval> <business-justification>bj</business-justification> <estimated-completion-date>11/05/2011 02:26 pm</estimated-completion-date> <actual-completion-date>11/08/2011 02:27 pm</actual-completion-date> <parent-change>96</parent-change> <estimated-cost>1000</estimated-cost> <actual-cost>2000</actual-cost> <actual-implementation-start-date>11/30/2011 02:31 PM</actual-implementation-start-date> <actual-implementation-end-date>11/30/2011 02:31 PM</actual-implementation-end-date> <backout-plan>bp</backout-plan> <template-name>Test</template-name> <need-by-date>11/08/2012 11:32 am</need-by-date> <call-back-date>11/09/2011 11:33 am</call-back-date> <root-cause>A</root-cause> <organization>org2</organization> <estimated-duration>02:30:50</estimated-duration> <actual-duration>10:40:00</actual-duration> </item> </items>
Parameter Description:
items[Required] The parent tag that contains item details
item[Required] This tag contains the input data for individual item
target[Conditional] This tag contains the dynamic target configuration details for every item. This is required if adapter configuration is left empty.
soap-url[Optional] CA Service Desk web service SOAP url. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence. Sample url format: https://<hostname>:<port>/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl
host[Optional] Hostname or IP Address of server where CA Service Desk is installed. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence.
user-name[Optional] User name required for authentication.
password[Optional] Password required for authentication.
port[Optional] Communication port for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - Any positive number greater than 0. Default value - 8080 for http, 8443 for https.
protocol[Optional] Communication protocol for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - http, https. Default value - https
install-certificate[Optional] Specifies if installation of certificates is desired. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
allow-unsigned-certificate[Optional] Specifies if unsigned certificates need to be allowed. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
passphrase[Optional] Password for authentication with the SSL certificate on the target server. Default value - changeit
requestor[Required] Name of the requestor associated with the change record Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
affected-end-user[Required] Affected end user for the change record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
assignee[Optional] Contact name to whom the change is assigned. If 'group' is also specified the assignee to whom change is assigned should be part of that group. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
business-case[Optional] Business case associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
category[Optional] Category associated with the change. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
status[Optional] Status of the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
priority[Optional] Priority associated with the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization to the default list of values is also supported.
created-by[Optional] User who creates this change record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Default value - Default session user Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name, first name, middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
group[Optional] Group to which change record is assigned. Valid values - Valid group name
cab[Optional] CAB associated with the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values.
impact[Optional] Impact associated with this change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
project[Optional] Project associated with the change record.
closure-code[Optional] Closure code of the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
summary[Optional] Summary associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
description[Optional] Description associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
schedule-start-date[Optional] Schedule start date associated with the change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
schedule-duration[Optional] Schedule duration associated with the change record. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30
cab-approval[Optional] Specifies whether the change has cab approval. Valid values - yes,no
business-justification[Optional] Business justification associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
estimated-completion-date[Optional] Esitmated completion date of this change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
actual-completion-date[Optional] Actual completion date for this change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
parent-change[Optional] Parent change associated with the change record. Valid values - Valid change id
estimated-cost[Optional] Estimated cost associated with this change record. Valid values - Any valid number
actual-cost[Optional] Actual cost associated with this change record. Valid values - Any valid number
actual-implementation-start-date[Optional] Actual implementation start date for this change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
actual-implementation-end-date[Optional] Actual implementation end date for this change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
backout-plan[Optional] Backout plan associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
template-name[Optional] Name of the template which will used to create the change order.
need-by-date[Optional] Need By date for this change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
call-back-date[Optional] Call back date for this change record. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
root-cause[Optional] Root cause for this change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
organization[Optional] Organization associatecd with this change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
estimated-duration[Optional] Estimated duration for this change record. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30
actual-duration[Optional] Actual duration for this change record. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30

documentation.description: This wrapper creates a new change record in the Service Desk system.
